articles.headline: In Bold Display, Taliban Order Stoning Deaths
articles.snippet: The killing of a couple who tried to elope was the Taliban’s first public execution since their fall from power.
articles.abstract: The killing of a couple who tried to elope was the Taliban’s first public execution since their fall from power.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Taliban on Sunday ordered their first public executions by stoning since their fall from power nine years ago, killing a young couple who had eloped, according to Afghan officials and a witness.

articles.headline: Bangladesh Arrests 21 After Rallies
articles.snippet: Garment industry labor leaders were among those arrested after protests over a recent increase in the minimum wage.
articles.abstract: Garment industry labor leaders were among those arrested after protests over a recent increase in the minimum wage.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India  The police in Bangladesh have arrested three garment industry labor leaders and 18 other people on charges that they organized and participated in violent protests last month.
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and Julfikar Ali Manik

articles.headline: Despite H.P.’s Efforts, Spectacle of a Chief Goes On
articles.snippet: Hewlett-Packard had hoped that Mark Hurd’s resignation would close this chapter, but a stream of leaks followed.
articles.abstract: Hewlett-Packard had hoped that Mark Hurd’s resignation would close this chapter, but a stream of leaks followed.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Even after a former actress in erotic films had accused Hewlett-Packard’s chief executive, Mark V. Hurd, of sexual harassment, the company’s board stood behind him.

articles.headline: Denmark Starts to Trim Its Admired Safety Net
articles.snippet: In June the government cut into its benefits system, the world’s most generous, by limiting unemployment payments to two years instead of four.
articles.abstract: In June the government cut into its benefits system, the world’s most generous, by limiting unemployment payments to two years instead of four.
articles.lead_paragraph: COPENHAGEN  How long is too long to be paid to go without a job?

articles.headline: 2 Zombies to Tolerate for a While
articles.snippet: Few people are happy with the mortgage buyers Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae, but the private market is not yet ready to step in for them.
articles.abstract: Few people are happy with the mortgage buyers Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae, but the private market is not yet ready to step in for them.

articles.headline: Aisle by Aisle, an App That Pushes Bargains
articles.snippet: Major retailers are working with a new smartphone app called Shopkick that tracks and offers promotions to users as they shop.
articles.abstract: Major retailers are working with a new smartphone app called Shopkick that tracks and offers promotions to users as they shop.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s like the most persistent sales clerk you’ve ever encountered.

articles.headline: Potash Producer Rejects Bid by BHP Billiton
articles.snippet: Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan dismissed the $38.6 billion offer as an effort to exploit the current downturn in the market for its commodity.
articles.abstract: Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan dismissed the $38.6 billion offer as an effort to exploit the current downturn in the market for its commodity.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — Rising demand for food from the fast-growing economies of the world has provoked a staggering $38.6 billion cash offer for a Canadian fertilizer company.
articles.byline: By Ian Austen and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Mortgage Role for U.S. Is Affirmed
articles.snippet: The Treasury secretary said continued government support was important “to make sure that Americans can borrow at reasonable interest rates to buy a house even in a downturn.”
articles.abstract: The Treasury secretary said continued government support was important “to make sure that Americans can borrow at reasonable interest rates to buy a house even in a downturn.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has been barraged with ideas for reworking the government’s role in housing finance, spanning the spectrum from guaranteeing all mortgage loans to eliminating all federal subsidies for homeownership.
